answerText: Bob Marley [or Robert Nesta Marley][10] In this Marley song he remembers "when we used to sit in the government yard in Trenchtown" and repeatedly advises "everything's gonna be alright."  A cover of this song was a minor hit for The Fugees.
heading: ACF Regionals  |2012 | South Carolina and Carlton | 21 | Trash | American | College
subject: Trash
question: Question: Identify the following regarding reggae, for 10 points each. [10] This Jamaican is undoubtedly the most famous reggae musician of all time. His reputation rests on albums like Exodus and songs like "One Love" and "Stir It Up." His musical children include Stephen and Damian.
